A new year is almost upon us. I can't wait to
see what the new year brings.

107615.「悪いけど もう一度 指示をくれないか？\n<bw_break>:
I'm sorry, but I'm gonna need your
instructions again.<bw_break>

107616.「お客さんへの伝言は 特にないってことで\n いいのかな？\n<yesno><b:
Is it okay if I don't have a message for the
customer?<yesno><break>

107617.「あれ <%sM_OWNER>。\n 名前が 入力されてないみたいだよ。\n<b:
Hey <%sM_OWNER>... It looks like you
didn't enter a name...<bw_break>

107620.「おっ。ずいぶんと かっこいい服だね！\n 一度 着てみたかったんだ こういうの:
Whoa. That's a pretty cool outfit! I've
always wanted to try it on. Will I feel like
a prince?

107621.「どうしたんだい？ 急に びっくりしたよ。\n ごめん 茶化したいわけじゃないん:
What's the matter with you? You startled me. I'm sorry, I didn't mean to make fun of you... I just... I know. I like you too. I
like you too. It's hard to tell with words. I'll always be there for you, so I'd appreciate it if you'd trust me with my
actions.

107625.「……へえ。なんだか ケーキとかを\n 作りたくなっちゃう服だね これ。\n ち:
..... This dress makes me want to bake a
cake... I think I'll give it a try.

107627.「これは どこかの学校の制服かな？\n こういうの着るの はじめてだよ。\n 僕:
Is this some kind of school uniform? I've
never worn anything like this before. It
looks good on me...

107628.「おっ。ずいぶん シブい服だね。\n 着物ってヤツかな これは。 \n 身が引き:
Whoa. It's so shabby... I guess it's called a
kimono... It looks like it'll help you stand
out...

107630.「『伝言を登録する』から 伝言を残してくれれば\n お客さんが この家に来たとき:
All you have to do is leave a message, and I'll pass it on to the guests when they come to the house. You can only leave a message
that's 20 words... You can change your message at any time, so leave any message you like...

107631.「この家に来た お客さんに 僕から\n 伝えられる伝言の量が 増えたよ。\n<b:
I've increased the amount of messages I can give to guests at this house. Before, you could only leave messages of up to 20 double-
byte characters, but starting today, you can leave messages of up to 60 double-byte characters... Please leave your
<%sM_OWNER> witty messages for our customers... I'll be sure to pass it on!

107632.「承知いたしました。\n では 雇いたいコンシェルジュの\n 種族と性別を お教: Yes, sir... Now, if you could tell us the species and gender of the concierge you'd like to hire...

107633.「『あいさつの頻度』から <%sM_OWNER>が\n 家に帰ってきた時の 僕か:
From the frequency of greetings, <%sM_OWNER> allows you to specify how often you want to be greeted by me when
you come home... To make your life easier, I'll greet you as often as you like, just tell me...

107634.「『立ちかたを変える』から 僕が普段\n <%sM_OWNER>に 接してるとき:
If you want to change the way I stand, you can specify the way I usually stand when I interact with <%sM_OWNER>. If you
specify how you want to stand, I'll use whatever way I want to stand.

107635.「あれ <%sM_OWNER> いたの？\n シャワーの音で 気付かなかったよ。:
Oh, my God. <%sM_OWNER> You're
here? I didn't hear you in the shower. I'm
sorry, I... I'll just... I'll be right out...

107636.「うおっと！ お客さんか！？\n シャワーの音で 気付かなかったよ。\n<br>:
Whoa! You got a visitor? You wouldn't know it
from the shower... Wait, wait, wait... I'll
be right out...

107638.「このところ 暑い日が多いから\n 外を走り回る冒険者は 大変だね。\n 家で:
It's been so hot here lately, it's hard for
adventurers to run around outside... I
thought I'd stay home and cool off.

107639.「暑い日が多くなると なんだか\n 動くのも おっくうになってくるよね。\n <:
As the days get hotter and hotter, it gets harder and harder to move... Is <%sM_OWNER> suffering from summer
fatigue?

107640.「暑い日は ずっと 家にいたら どう？\n でも <%sM_OWNER>は 冒険:
Why don't you just stay home when it's hot?
But <%sM_OWNER> is an adventurer,
so...

107643.「今は <%sM_NOW_TACHIKATA>で\n 立っているんだけど\n ど: Right now, I'm standing with <%sM_NOW_TACHIKATA>, but which way do you prefer me to stand?

107644.「じゃあ 立ちかたを\n <%sM_TACHIKATA>に\n 変えるけど それ:
I'll change the standing style to
<%sM_TACHIKATA>, is that okay?<yesno><break>

107645.「オッケー わかったよ。\n 今度からは <%sM_TACHIKATA>で\n:
Okay, okay... From now on, I'll be using
<%sM_TACHIKATA>...

107646.「愛してる……か。\n なかなか 普段 使わない言葉だよね。\n<br>\n「い:
I love you. .... It's not a word I use very often... No, no, no! I can't get the words to come out... I'm not trying to say this!
I'm... I'm clumsy and... It's just that you're so direct with your pitches, and... I thought you were special, too. And... Hmm?
I... Are you saying you love me? Oh, no. Don't freak me out!

107647.「この時間は 外も静かになってくるし\n なんだか 落ち着くね。:
At this time of night, it's getting quiet
outside, and I feel...

107648.「今日は 掃除をがんばろうかな。\n 読みたい本も たまってるんだけど\n まず:
I'll do my best to clean today. I have a lot
of books I want to read, but I have to work
first.

107649.「この家のことは 僕に まかせておけば\n バッチリさ <%sM_OWNER>。:
I'll take care of the house, and you'll be in
good hands. <%sM_OWNER>... Don't
worry. We'll take you on an adventure...

107650.「ああ おなかが空いてきたな。\n そろそろ 昼ごはんの時間か……。\n 何を:
Oh, I'm starving. I think it's time for
lunch. I don't know what I'm gonna eat.

107651.「<%sM_OWNER>。もう ごはん食べた？\n 僕は まだなんだよね。\n:
<%sM_OWNER>... Have you eaten yet? I
haven't... I've been so busy...

107652.「このくらいの時間は\n なんだか 眠くなってくるよなあ。\n でも 大丈夫。寝:
I feel sleepy around this time... But... I
don't want to fall asleep...

107653.「ねえ <%sM_OWNER>。\n そろそろ お茶の時間にしてもいいかな？\n:
Hey, <%sM_OWNER>... Is it okay if I
make you some tea? I need to take a break...

107654.「<%sM_OWNER>。また 出かけるのかい？\n 家に ひとりでいるのは 退:
<%sM_OWNER>... Are you going out
again? It's boring being home alone, but I'll
live with it...

107655.「<%sM_OWNER> おかえり。\n 無事に戻って来てくれて よかった。\n:
<%sM_OWNER> Oh... I'm glad you're
back safe and sound. I thought I'd come home
and rest...

107656.「<%sM_OWNER> おなか 空かないか？\n 僕のカンじゃ そろそろ\n:
<%sM_OWNER> Are you hungry? I
have a hunch that it's almost time for
dinner, so...

107657.「<%sM_OWNER>。\n 今日も１日 お疲れさま。\n この後はもう 家で:
<%sM_OWNER>... It's been a long day.
I think I'll just go home and relax...

107658.「あ～ もう こんな時間か。\n <%sM_OWNER>は まだ寝なくていいのか:
Oh, no... Shouldn't <%sM_OWNER>
be in bed yet?

107659.「やあ <%sM_OWNER>。\n 今日は バッチリ 掃除をしてたんだ。\n:
Hey, <%sM_OWNER>... I've been doing
a lot of cleaning today. It's looking good,
isn't it?

107660.「このくらいになると 静かだから\n <%sM_OWNER>と ふたりで\n ゆ:
It's quiet around here, so it's a good time
for you and <%sM_OWNER> to
talk...

107661.「<%sM_OWNER> お疲れさまー。\n 今日も がんばったみたいだね。\n:
<%sM_OWNER> Good work... You've
worked hard today... I think it's time you
took a break.

107662.「<%sM_OWNER> 遅かったじゃないか。\n まあ <%sM_OWNER>:
<%sM_OWNER> You're late... Well,
I figured <%sM_OWNER> no matter
what, you'd come home...

107663.「<%sM_OWNER> そろそろ 眠くない？\n ベッドの用意は できてるから:
<%sM_OWNER> Aren't you ready to

rest whenever you want...

107664.「<%sM_OWNER>は まだ寝ないのかな。\n 僕は そろそろ 眠くなってき:
<%sM_OWNER> is not going to
bed... I'm starting to get sleepy...

107665.「<%sM_OWNER> まだ起きてて いいのかい？\n ちゃんと寝ないと 身体:
<%sM_OWNER> Are you sure you want

107666.「<%sM_OWNER> 早いね。\n もう 冒険に出かけるのかい？:
<%sM_OWNER> ... Are you going on

107667.「やあ <%sM_OWNER>。\n 今日も 元気そうで 何より。\n 僕？ も:

107668.「<%sM_OWNER>は 今日は\n どんな１日に なると思う？\n 僕は い:

107669.「<%sM_OWNER>。これから 出かけるのか？\n 忘れものとかしないように:

107671.「新たに プライベートコンシェルジュに\n 命令していただけることが 増えました:

107673.「雨って やっかいだよね。\n まったく降らないと 困るけど\n 降りすぎても:

we're in trouble. But if it rains too much...

107674.「最近 雨が多いから むし暑いね。\n こういうときは 体調くずしやすいから\n:
It's been raining a lot lately, so... It's
easy to get sick at times like this, so be
careful with <%sM_OWNER>...

107675.「<%sM_OWNER> 冒険に出かけるなら\n カサを 持ってったほうがいいよ:

107677.「外は だいぶ 寒くなって\n すっかり 冬が来たって感じだね。\n 風邪とかに:
It's getting colder outside. It feels like
winter has come... Watch out for colds and...

107678.「寒い日が続くと あったかいものが\n 食べたくなるねえ。\n ナベものとか い:
The cold weather makes me want to eat
something warm... Like a casserole...

107680.「寒くなってくると ワクワクするんだ。\n ちょっと待てば クリスマスが来て\n:
The colder it gets, the more excited I get...

be here and New Year's will be here soon!

107684.「では 雇いたいコンシェルジュの\n 種族と性別を お教えください。\n<bre:
Now, please tell us the race and gender of
the concierge you'd like to hire.<break>

107685.「現在 <%sM_NAME>さんを 雇っています。\n 一度 お別れしてしまうと:
I'm currently employed by <%sM_NAME>... Once you part ways with someone, you can't hire the same person
again... Also, any gifts you gave to the person you're leaving will be lost and passed on to the new person. Please make your
decision carefully. Do you want to part with <%sM_NAME> and hire <%sM_BEFORE_NAME> again?

107686.「プライベートコンシェルジュを\n 雇いますか？\n<yesno><break>: Would you like to hire a private concierge?<yesno><break>

107688.「承知いたしました。\n では<%sM_BEFORE_NAME>さんを お呼びし:
Yes, sir... I will now call upon Mr.
<%sM_BEFORE_NAME>... Where would

107689.プライベートコンシェルジュの\n<%sM_BEFORE_NAME>さんが 家にや: Your private concierge, <%sM_BEFORE_NAME>, is in the house!

107690.「今日は １度プライベートコンシェルジュを\n 雇っているので 新しい方は雇えま:
We've already hired a private concierge once
today, so we can't hire a new one... You can
try again tomorrow...

107703.「プライベートコンシェルジュについて\n ご説明します。\n 何について 知りた:
Learn about our private concierge... What
would you like to know about?<break>

107705.「プライベートコンシェルジュを雇うと\n 旅のコンシェルジュと モンスター酒場の:
When you hire a Private Concierge, you'll be able to use some of the features of the Travel Concierge and the Monster Tavern...
First, you'll be able to receive Support Gold and Casino Tokens from your Private Concierge... You'll also be able to exchange
your Genki-dama and Tokkun Genki-dama from the Private Concierge... Please note that this service is only available to those who
can train... Please note that... As part of the Monster Tavern functions, you can now use "Take Me Out", "Give Me Away", "Monster
Farm", and "Dress Up Goods"...

107706.「プライベートコンシェルジュに\n プラコンスーツ・青などの 服アイテムを\n:
When you give a Private Concierge an item of clothing... such as the Placon suit in blue... they can change it for you. Once
you've given a Private Concierge an item of clothing... they can change it at any time... by clicking on the "Change clothes" link
under "Teach me how to behave". Please note that if you terminate your Private Concierge, the gift will be lost.

107707.「プライベートコンシェルジュに\n 口調の書・甘えん坊などの アイテムを\n 贈:
If you give a private concierge a tone book or a pampered child, they can change your tone. You can change the tone of voice once
you've given it to your Private Concierge by clicking "Change Tone" under "Teach Me How to Act". Please note that if you fire your
Private Concierge, the gift will be lost.

107708.「プライベートコンシェルジュに\n 贈ることができるプレゼントには\n さまざま:

private concierge... Gifts such as dresses and suits, when given, will allow you to change from "teach you how to behave" to
"change your clothes"... Whenever you give a tone book as a gift, you can change your tone of voice by going to "Change your tone" under
"Teach me how to behave"... Plakon Bath Set... It's so that your daughter can use it from time to time when she comes home. If you hold a gift in your hand and talk to your private
concierge, they'll give you a gift... You can give your private concierge a variety of gifts.
You can grow it to your liking...
